page.title: 18WHY WE CAME TO LIVE HERE
page.content: Our move to East Meon in August 1984 was the result of need and happy circumstance. The need was to find a location roughly equidistant between my place of work and my wife's newly relocated government office. The cicumstance related to the house-and apparently Tudor thatched building in this lovely village-which had failed the sale of auction and which could thus be bought privately in the time scale within which we needed to operate. We had not expected to be able to buy such a house in such a location but we moved out in faith and everything just fell into place!
